owl:Ontology.rdfs:label: DataONE PROV Extension for Scientific Workflow Provenance
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: This document describes an extension of the W3C PROV standard for scientific workflow provenance, developed in the context of the DataONE Project. It represents a potential standard published publicly for evaluation and possible adoption. However, it is not associated with or is supported by any standards organisation.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: CLtoDestP
owl:ObjectProperty.prov:category: Relates a SeqCtrlLink to its destination Process.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Connects a DataLink to an InputPort of a Process, while the same DataLink can be connected to an OutputPort of another Process.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: DLToInPort

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Connects a DataLink to the OutputPort of a Process. In turn, the same DataLink can be linked to the OutputPort of a nested Process.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: DLToOutPort

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specifies that a particular Data item was associated with a particular DataLink of a Workflow during its execution. It effectively links the trace information of a workflow to the workflow structure, by capturing the dataflow event.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: dataOnLink

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specifies that a given InputPort has a certain Data item as a default parameter. This enables to specify especially configured Workflow instances.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasDefaultParam

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Enables to specify the InputPorts of a particular Process.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasInPort

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Enables to specify the OutputPorts of a particular Process.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasOutPort

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specifies the recursive composition of Processes, a parent Process includes a child Process as part of its specification.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasSubProcess

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Connects the InputPort of a Process to a DataLink. In turn, the same DataLink can then be connected to the InputPort of a nested Process.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: inPortToDL

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specifies the structure of ProcessExecution instances, a parent ProcessExecution (associated with a Workflow) has child ProcessExecutions (associated with Processes and subworkflows).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: isPartOf

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Connects an OutputPort of a Process to a DataLink, which then can be linked to an InputPort of another Process.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: outPortToDL

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates a SeqCtrlLink to its source Process.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: sourcePToCL

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Data item represents the basic unit of information consumed and produced by a Process. Multiple Data items may be grouped into a Collection.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A DataLink enables to send Data items between Processes, always connecting an OutputPort from one Process to the InputPort in another Process. It is possibe for an OutputPort as well as for an InputPort to be the source or destination of multiple DataLinks, respectively.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DataLink
InputPort
owl:Class.prov:category: An InputPort enables a Process to receive input Data items, which in turn may be produced by other Processes and sent through DataLinks or specified as default parameters.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: OutputPort
owl:Class.prov:category: An OutputPort enables a Process to produce output Data items, which may be forwarded to other Processes via DataLinks.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Process
owl:Class.prov:definition: A Process represents a computational task that consumes and produces data through its input and output ports, respectively. It can be atomic or composite, the latter case represented by a possibly nested Process. It is also subject to versioning by prov:wasDerivedFrom.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: SeqCtrlLink
owl:Class.prov:category: A SeqCtrlLink specifies a sequential control link between two Processes. A source Process is linked to a destination process, the latter can only begin its execution once the source process sends the respective signal through the link. In case a Process is the destination of multiple sequential control links, all of their activation signals must be received in order for the execution to begin.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: User
owl:Class.prov:definition: An User is the person responsible for the specification of a Process, which in turn can be a Workflow. Its specification serves attribution and accountability purposes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Workflow
owl:Class.prov:definition: A Workflow is a distinguished Process, which indicates that is meant to represent the computational experiment in its entirety. It is also subject to versioning by prov:wasDerivedFrom through its super-class provone:Process.
